titleStmt.title: James J. Long et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG9021

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To the Most Excellent Govoner of Ky Jas. F. Robinson this petition is by the friends of Stephen Brydon we believe Mr Brydon ^deserves interferencence and^ that we are doing right to interfere in his behalf and would most earnestly desire your behelp or would ask your interference that is to remit four fines against him the judgement was given against him Febr Term Finding him in four diferent cases for selling Licquor not according to law sixty ^dollars^ each making two hundred and forty dollars he is not able to work and we believe he knew not the consequences of selling not according to law

Jas J Long
W C Scott
Jas Sullivan
Max Dinkespiel
B. Jacoby

Stephen Brydon
Pettn to remit fine selling liquor
Refused
